context: This criteria evaluates how well an engineer uses the @emoji-toolkit/combiner package to implement emoji formatting functionality. The focus is on correct usage of ZWJ sequences, preset sequences, and pattern generation functions.

checklist.name: ZWJ Profession Creation
checklist.description: Uses createProfession() function to combine person emoji with profession symbol for developer (üíª), scientist (üî¨), and chef (üç≥) professions. Should properly join emojis with Zero-Width Joiner.

checklist.name: Preset Sequence Retrieval
checklist.description: Uses getPresetSequence() function to retrieve moon and time preset sequences. Should correctly return preset sequences by name and handle unknown presets by returning empty string.

checklist.name: Wave Pattern Generation
checklist.description: Uses wave() function to create wave patterns with rising and falling emoji counts. Should properly implement space-separated pattern that peaks at the specified maxCount.

checklist.name: Mirror Pattern Creation
checklist.description: Uses mirror() function to create palindromic emoji sequences. Should correctly create mirrored patterns from emoji arrays.

checklist.name: ZWJ Sequence Detection
checklist.description: Uses isZWJSequence() function to detect professional emojis. Should correctly identify ZWJ sequences (return true for profession emojis) and distinguish them from regular emojis (return false).

checklist.name: Emoji Decomposition
checklist.description: Uses splitZWJ() or decomposeZWJ() function to break down ZWJ sequences into component emojis. Should correctly return an array of individual emoji components.
